definition: A unit of time that is commonly used to measure short durations, typically equal to 1/60th of a minute. It is often utilized in scientific contexts, such as in physics or astronomy, to denote precise time intervals or to measure the duration of events.

examples.english: I'll be there in a second.

examples.german: Er hat den Rekord in der 100-Meter-Sprint in 9,58 Sekunden gebrochen.
examples.english: He broke the record in the 100-meter sprint in 9.58 seconds.
